question: Next Israel x Hamas ceasefire in August?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if the next official ceasefire agreement, defined as a publicly announced and mutually upon agreed halt in military engagement, between Israel and Hamas begins between August 1, 2024, 12:00 AM ET, and August 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET.

This market's resolution will be based on official government announcements from both Israel and Hamas, or a consensus of credible reporting confirming that both parties have agreed to a ceasefire.

events.title: Next Israel x Hamas ceasefire in…?
events.description: This is a market on predicting the timing of the next ceasefire between Israel and Hamas.

question: No Israel x Hamas ceasefire in 2024?

This market will resolve to "Yes" if there is no official ceasefire agreement, defined as a publicly announced and mutually upon agreed halt in military engagement, between Israel and Hamas that begins between June 10, 2024, 12:00 AM ET, and December 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

This market's resolution will be based on official government announcements from both Israel and Hamas, or reports from credible media source.

question: X banned in Brazil before October?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if use of X/Twitter is banned within Brazil for the majority of Brazilian citizens between August 18 and September 30, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

"Banned" is defined as Brazilian citizens are officially barred from downloading and/or viewing X/Twitter, and/or posting on X/Twitter.

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the Brazilian government and X/Twitter, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: CFB: NDSU vs. Colorado
description:
In the upcoming NCAA Football game, scheduled for August 29 at 8:00 PM ET:

If the Colorado Buffaloes win, the market will resolve to “Colorado”

If the North Dakota State Bison win, the market will resolve to “NDSU”.

If the game is not completed by September 5, 2024 (11:59 PM ET) or it ends in a tie, the market will resolve 50-50.

events.title: CFB: NDSU vs. Colorado
events.description:
In the upcoming NCAA Football game, scheduled for August 29 at 8:00 PM ET:

If the Colorado Buffaloes win, the market will resolve to “Colorado”

If the North Dakota State Bison win, the market will resolve to “NDSU”.

If the game is not completed by September 5, 2024 (11:59 PM ET) or it ends in a tie, the market will resolve 50-50.

question: Will Donald Trump say "tampon" during Pennsylvania rally?
description:
Donald Trump is scheduled to host a rally in Johnstown, Pennsylvania, scheduled for Friday, August 30, 2024.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Trump says "tampon" during his appearance at this event. Otherwise, the market will resolve to "No".

Any usage of the word regardless of context will count toward the resolution of this market.

Pluralization/possessive of the word will count toward the resolution of this market, however other forms will NOT count.

Compound words will count as long as "tampon" is part of the compound word and references the meaning which refers to the feminine hygiene product.

If this candidate does not give a speech at this event, or if the event is otherwise cancelled or delayed beyond August 30, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source will be the video of the speech.

question: Will Lana Del Rey dump her boyfriend before October?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Lana Del Rey and Jeremy Dufrene end their romantic relationship by September 30, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Confirmation can come in various forms, including, but not limited to, social media posts, interviews, press releases, official statements, or a consensus of credible reporting. This market will resolve to "No" otherwise.

If it's unclear whether or not they are in a romantic relationship, this market will resolve to the side with the stronger argument based on credible reporting.

question: Mark Zuckerberg out as Facebook CEO in 2024?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Mark Zuckerberg is no longer serving as CEO of Meta Platforms for any length of time between August 28, and December 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

An announcement of Mark Zuckerberg's resignation/firing before this market's end date will immediately resolve this market to "Yes", regardless of when the announced resignation/firing goes into effect.

This market's primary resolution source will be official information from Meta Platforms and/or Mark Zuckerberg, however a consensus of credible reporting sources will also be used.

question: Will Scottie Scheffler win the Tour Championship?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Scottie Scheffler wins the 2024 Tour Championship. Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”.

The primary resolution sources will be official information from the Tour Championship (https://www.pgatour.com/leaderboard.

This market may immediately resolve to “No” if this golfer is eliminated or otherwise has no path to victory based on the rules of the 2024 Tour Championship Tournament.

question: Will another golfer win the Tour Championship?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if anyone other than Scottie Scheffler, Xander Schauffele, Hideki Matsuyama, Rory McIlroy, Ludvig Aberg, Sam Burns, Collin Morikawa, Patrick Cantlay, Keegan Bradley, Wyndham Clark, Viktor Hovland, Tony Finau, Sungjae Im, Tommy Fleetwood, or Russell Henley wins the 2024 Tour Championship. Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”.

The primary resolution sources will be official information from the Tour Championship (https://www.pgatour.com/leaderboard).

This market may immediately resolve to “No” if every golfer other than those previously listed is eliminated or otherwise has no path to victory based on the rules of the 2024 Tour Championship Tournament.

question: Will Donald Trump say "Jesus" during Pennsylvania rally?
description:
Donald Trump is scheduled to host a rally in Johnstown, Pennsylvania, scheduled for Friday, August 30, 2024.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Trump says "Jesus" during his appearance at this event. Otherwise, the market will resolve to "No".

Any usage of the word regardless of context will count toward the resolution of this market.

Pluralization/possessive of the word will count toward the resolution of this market, however other forms will NOT count.

Compound words will count as long as "Jesus" is part of the compound word and references the meaning which refers to the central figure of the Christian faith, Jesus Christ.

If this candidate does not give a speech at this event, or if the event is otherwise cancelled or delayed beyond August 30, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source will be the video of the speech.

question: OpenSea blocks US users in 2024?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if OpenSea (https://opensea.io/) geoblocks users from the United States of America from trading NFTs between August 28 and December 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

If USA users are still allowed to sell or close out already-held NFTs, it will still count as a block, so long as they are blocked from purchasing new ones.

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from OpenSea, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: X banned in Brazil by Friday?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if use of X/Twitter is banned within Brazil for the majority of Brazilian citizens between August 28 and August 30, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

"Banned" is defined as Brazilian citizens are officially barred from downloading and/or viewing X/Twitter, and/or posting on X/Twitter.

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the Brazilian government and X/Twitter, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: Kamala flips Trump on Silver's Bulletin by Sept 6?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Kamala Harris is more likely to win the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election than Donald Trump according to the Silver Bulletin for any date between August 30 and September 6, 2024 (inclusive). Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

This market will resolve as soon as a flip occurs, or otherwise once figures are available for every date within this market's range.

If there are updates to previous figures before the release of the last figure it will count for this market. However, any updates after the release of the September 6 figures will not be considered. 

The resolution source will be Silver Bulletin's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model, specifically the probability of winning the Electoral College.

Note: Ties will not qualify as a flip. The model must show Kamala Harris with a greater probability of winning the electoral college than Donald Trump.

question: Will Pablo Marçal win the 2024 São Paulo mayoral election?
description:
The 2024 São Paulo mayoral election is scheduled to take place on October 6. If no candidate receives a majority of votes, a runoff election will be held on October 27, 2024. This is a market asking who will be the ultimate victor.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if Pablo Marçal wins the 2024 São Paulo mayoral election. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

If a runoff election is triggered and this candidate is no longer in consideration for Mayor of São Paulo, this market will resolve immediately to "No".

If the election is delayed beyond December 31, 2024 ET, or the election is otherwise not held by that date, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source for this market will be official information from the Tribunal Superior Eleitoral (TSE) (www.tse.jus.br) and/or the official process by which electoral disputes are arbitrated in Brazil.

question: US Open: Shelton vs. Tiafoe
description:
Ben Shelton and Francis Tiafoe are scheduled to play each other in a third round matchup in the US Open Men’s Singles Tournament on August 30, 2024 at 1:15 PM ET. 

This market will resolve to “Shelton” if Ben Shelton wins his match against Francis Tiafoe in the third round of the US Open Men’s Singles tournament. 

This market will resolve to “Tiafoe” if Francis Tiafoe wins his match against Ben Shelton in the third round of the US Open Men’s Singles tournament. 

If the match ends in a tie, is canceled, or delayed beyond September 6, 2024, this market will resolve to 50-50.

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US Open (ex:https://www.usopen.org/index.html) including live footage, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question: Will Apple remain largest company through Sep 30?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Apple (AAPL) remains the largest company in the world by market cap during market hours between Aug 28 and market close on September 30, 2024. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

If another company overtakes it as the largest company during market hours before the deadline, this market will immediately resolve to "No."

The resolution source for this market will be a consensus of credible reporting.
